lines.content: * The main class for the Caviar chatbot application.

*

Caviar is an interactive task manager that allows users to add,
* manage, and store tasks with deadlines and events.
* Initializes the chatbot, loading tasks from storage if available.
* @param filePath The path to the storage file.
* @throws CaviarException If an error occurs while loading tasks.
* Runs the main interaction loop of Caviar chatbot.

*

The chatbot continuously waits for user input and processes commands
ui.showMessage("Roe. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Processes a user command and executes the corresponding action.
* @param input The command input from the user.
* @throws CaviarException If the command is invalid.
private void processCommand(String input) throws CaviarException {
* The main entry point of the Caviar application.
* Represents a list of tasks that can be modified and stored.

*

The {@code TaskList} class manages task additions, deletions,
* Constructs an empty {@code TaskList} without storage.
this.storage = null; // Indicate that storage is unavailable
this.tasks = new ArrayList<>(); // No storage dependency
* Constructs a {@code TaskList} and loads tasks from storage.
* @param storage The storage instance to load tasks from.
* @throws IOException     If there is an issue reading from the storage file.
* @throws CaviarException If the storage file contains invalid task data.
public TaskList(Storage storage) throws IOException, CaviarException {
this.tasks = storage.load(); // Load tasks from file
* Lists all tasks in the current task list.
* Displays a message if the task list is empty.
System.out.println("    Roe..? No tasks in the list yet.");
System.out.println("    Roe! Here are the tasks in your list:");
* @throws IOException If an error occurs during saving.
System.out.println("    Roe! I've added this task:");
"    Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task" + (tasks.size() > 1 ? "s" : "") + " in the list. Roe roe.");
* Marks the specified task as done.
* @param index The index of the task to mark as done.
* @throws CaviarException If the index is out of range.
public void markTask(int index) throws CaviarException {
throw new CaviarException("No such task exists, roe..!!");
System.out.println("    Roe! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks the specified task as not done.

*

If the storage is available, this method also updates the tasks in the
* @param index The index of the task to mark as not done.
* @throws CaviarException If the index is out of range (invalid task index).
public void unmarkTask(int index) throws CaviarException {
throw new CaviarException("No such task exists, roe..!!");
System.out.println("    Roe! I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Removes a task from the list based on its index.

*

If the storage is available, this method also updates the tasks in the
* @param index The index of the task to remove.
* @throws CaviarException If the index is out of range (invalid task index).
public void deleteTask(int index) throws CaviarException {
throw new CaviarException("No such task exists, roe..!!");
System.out.println("    Roe! I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("    Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list. Roe roe.");
* Saves all tasks to the underlying storage.

*

If no storage is set (i.e., {@code storage == null}), this method does nothing.
* @throws IOException If an I/O error occurs while writing tasks to the storage file.
* Finds tasks that contain the specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for.
* Shows all deadlines that occur on the specified date.

*

If no matching deadlines are found, a message is displayed instead.
* @param dateStr The date string in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format.
* Represents an exception specific to the Caviar application.
* Handles parsing and execution of corresponding command.
* Parses and executes the user input.
* @param ui       The UI instance for interaction.
* @throws CaviarException if the command is invalid.
public static void parseAndExecute(String input, TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CaviarException {
ui.showMessage("Roe. Hope to see you again soon!");
throw new CaviarException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new CaviarException("The deadline format is incorrect! Use: deadline <task> /by <date>.");
throw new CaviarException("The event format is incorrect! Use: event <task> /from <start> /to <end>.");
throw new CaviarException("roe..!! Please specify a keyword to search.");
ui.showMessage("Roe! Here are the matching tasks:");
throw new CaviarException("Mark which task? roe..!!");
throw new CaviarException("Unmark which task? roe..!!");
throw new CaviarException("Delete which task? roe..!!");
throw new CaviarException("I don't understand roe..?");
* Manages storage of tasks by saving and loading them to/from a file.

If the storage file's directory does not exist, it is created automatically.

* Represents a Todo task, which is a simple task without any date or time.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Tests the behavior of the {@link TaskList} class.
* Initializes a new {@link TaskList} before each test.
* Tests if a task can be added to the task list.
* Tests if a task can be deleted from the task list.
* Tests the behavior of the {@link Parser} class.
private final TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
private final Ui ui = new Ui();
private final Storage storage = new Storage("data/test_tasks.txt");
* Tests if a "todo" command correctly adds a task.
* @throws CaviarException If there is an error executing the command.
Parser.parseAndExecute("todo read book", taskList, ui, storage);
* Tests if an invalid command throws a {@link CaviarException}.
assertTrue(exception.getMessage().contains("roe..!!"), "Should throw an error for unknown commands.");
assertEquals(2, results.size(), "Both tasks should be found.");
* Tests the behavior of the {@link Task} class.
* Tests if a task can be marked as done.
assertTrue(task.isDone, "Task should be marked as done.");
* Tests if a task can be marked as not done after being completed.
assertFalse(task.isDone, "Task should be marked as not done.");
* JUnit test class for the {@link Todo} class.
* Tests creation of a Todo task.
Todo todo = new Todo("Finish Gradle setup");
* Tests marking a Todo task as done.
Todo todo = new Todo("Finish Gradle setup");
